name: RPG in a Box Mini's
description:
This page is home to mini projects made whilst learning to use RPG in a Box. The games are short and lacking polish but fully playable and completable. I've uploaded them as curiosities more than anything.

Games:

Currently there are two mini projects available:

Cyber Streets - a very short, interactable walking sim which has the player searching for a hidden stash in a cyberpunk themed street.

Brigands Abound - a short dungeon crawl clearing out brigands hiding beneath an abandoned castle.

Basic controls:

Left click - Move, Interact, Attack

Right click - Hold to rotate camera

Mouse wheel - Zoom in/out

I or click pack icon in top right - Show/Hide Inventory

Esc - Open main menu

Cyber Streets specific controls

Tools - click the hand icon next to the pack icon to cycle through available tools. Interactable game elements requiring the selected tool with change icon when hovered over.

Brigands Abound specific controls

Character and Equip screens - with the inventory open click the sword or XP icon in the top middle to toggle the character stats and equipped items screen. Left click an equipped item to pick it up and left click again to place it in an inventory slot. If equipment is changed the player needs to click the Update button on the stats screen to show changes to Attack and Defense

Inventory screen - right click to use consumable items

Credits

RPG in a Box Mini's are made with RPG in a Box, a tool for easily creating 3D grid-based, voxel-style RPGs and adventure games. Check it out if you are interested in creating your own game!

(Cyber Streets) Music by Josh Penn-Pierson.

(Cyber Streets) Visuals inspired by and based on Cyberpunk Voxel City - monogon by Max Parata
